greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest multiple of 7 not appearing earlier that ends with n.
comment: The sequence is a permutation of the positive multiples of 7. - _Vladimir Shevelev_, May 24 2015
A258329(n) = a(n) / 7 is a permutation of the positive integers. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 27 2015
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..9999
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = For[k = 7, True, k = k + 7, If[Divisible[k - n, 10^IntegerLength[n]] && FreeQ[Array[a, n-1], k], Return[k]]]; Array[a, 54] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 07 2018 *)
program: f x ws = g ws where
g ((u, vs) : uvs) = if isPrefixOf xs vs
then u : f (x + 1) (delete (u, vs) ws) else g uvs
results.author: _Eric Angelini_ and _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 23 2015
